$HYPE  is stuck at $27.009 after hitting a wall at $27.28 again. Sellers are jumping in fast whenever it spikes. Huge trading volume shows everyone is fighting for a spot. You can use MEXC and their zero fee setup to handle this choppy market. It lets traders adjust trades quickly without losing cash on costs.

Who is going to be the winner this cycle?

HyperLiquid? Lighter? Aster? Backpack? Maybe farming Ostium makes sense.

You can build a thousand arguments for any of these projects. Some will spike hard, like @virtuals_io and its AI agents, then crash under market pressure, competition, or simply time.

But how much does any of that really matter when $BTC is still ~30% away from its ATH?

Thatâ€™s the point many miss.

Why argue about L1s, L2s, L3s, narratives and rotations when:

equities are near all-time highs

metals are at highs

If the â€œbull runâ€ stalls or reverses, everything except BTC gets hit hard.

Alts can drop 50%+ while Bitcoin historically loses 10â€“15%.

BTC has no real competitors. Gold comes closest, and that actually works in Bitcoinâ€™s favor.

Every cycle, every crisis, every war brings more capital into BTC as a neutral, global asset.

Maybe that changes one day.

But right now, we donâ€™t see a better alternative.

Hyperliquid $HYPE   is currently a focal point for volatility in early 2026. The network recently activated HIP-3, enabling permissionless perpetual market creation, which has pushed daily volumes to new highs. However, on-chain data reveals a massive $327 million token unlock this January, designated for core contributors. While this typically creates selling pressure, the protocol's $2 million daily buyback program is providing a significant liquidity cushion. Notably, a dormant cluster tied to Tornado Cash recently unstaked $6.9 million in HYPE, signaling potential distribution. Technically, HYPE is testing a critical $50.06 neckline resistance. If the upcoming HyperEVM expansion successfully attracts more DeFi deployments, analysts expect HYPE to break toward the $70 mark by the end of Q1 2026.
